description: {"blocks":[{"key":"90uhs","text":"Protocol for viral injections and GRIN lens placement used in Mendonça et al 2024. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6mvkc","text":"All procedures were done in aseptic conditions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1v9ra","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i8s5","text":"Experiments were done on male mice-C57BL/6 or B6.SJL-Slc6a3tm1.1(Cre)Bkmn/J (Jax labs stock #006660). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"5h5ph","text":"-Stereotaxic surgery set up required (this protocol uses Kopf insturments)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78svd","text":"-GCaMP6f stock viral solution -AAV2/5.SYN.FlexGCaMP6fWPRE.SV40 - University of Pennsylvania","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eub2h","text":"-GRIN Lens is A 500-um diameter, 8.2-mm long gradient index (GRIN) lens (GLP-0584, Inscopix).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8bdq7","text":"Place the anesthetized mouse in the stereotaxic apparatus then stabilize the head. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2i53p","text":"Make a skin incision to expose the skull.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"331c2","text":"Carefully remove any connective and muscle tissue from the exposed area. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6mndg","text":"Level the skull surface to be at less than 0.05mm by comparing the height of bregma and lambda, and also in medial-lateral directions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akroa","text":"Inject GCaMP6f stock viral solution (AAV2/5.SYN.FlexGCaMP6fWPRE.SV40 - University of Pennsylvania). Note-The virus solution is kept at -80 ºC and thawed at room temperature just before the injection. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Optogenetics Injections
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ev4p","text":"Virus volume of 1.5 nL was injected in the substantia nigra compacta at the following coordinates: -3.16 mm anteroposterior, 1.40mm lateral from bregma and 4.20 deep from the brain surface. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Injections for Imaging
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eobcp","text":"For imaging, 1 ul of virus solution was injected in the right (n=3) or the left (n=3) substantia nigra compacta at the following coordinates: -3.16 mm anteroposterior, 1.40mm lateral from bregma and 4.20 deep from the brain surface. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4mf64","text":"Find the injection coordinates and mark area for drilling: Substantia nigra compacta was injected at the following coordinates: -3.16 mm anteroposterior, 1.40mm lateral from bregma and 4.20 deep from the brain surface.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b5vkd","text":"Drill Burr-holes in marked areas carefully.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5eel7","text":"Load glass pipette into the pipette holder (Nanojet II or Nanojet III (Drummond Scientific)) and affix to the stereotaxic frame. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6ikce","text":"Set rate of injection to 4.6 nL per 5 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"71l49","text":"After the injection finishes, leave the pipette in place for 10-15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e76l9","text":" Please initially follow stereotaxic surgery section. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evgic","text":"The lens is then fixed in place using cyanoacrilate, quick adhesive cement (C\u0026B Metabond) and black dental cement (Ortho-Jet).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d16q5","text":"A blunt 28 G needle was lowered to 3 mm deep from the brain surface to facilitate the lowering of the GRIN lens.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5na8k","text":"After the injection finishes, leave the pipette in place for 10-15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2aksv","text":"The GRIN lens was then lowered at the same coordinates as the AAV injection coordinates (-3.16 mm anteroposterior, 1.40mm lateral from bregma and 4.20 deep from the brain surface.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bgcu","text":"GRIN Lens is A 500-um diameter, 8.2-mm long gradient index (GRIN) lens (GLP-0584, Inscopix).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1442h","text":"Mouse recovers for 3 weeks post-GRIN placement, then a baseplate was positioned. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"57m1m","text":"Mouse is anesthetized with isoflurane and fixed with head bars. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fb7i","text":"A baseplante (BPC-2, Inscopix) attached to a mini epifluorescence microscope (nVista HD, Inscopix) is then positioned above the GRIN lens.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ditd1","text":"To correctly position the baseplate, brain tissue was imaged through the lens to find the appropriate focal plane using 40% LED power, a frame rate of 10 Hz and a digital gain of 4. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajhia","text":"Once the focal plane was set, the baseplate was cemented to the rest of the cap using the same dental cement. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3obe","text":"Imaging with the GRIN lense started 2–3 days after this final step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
